required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Water Oxygenation and Brain Activity: A Magnetoencephalographic (MEG) Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this interventional, placebo controlled, crossover, double blind, basic science exploratory study is to investigate whether there is a difference in brain electrophysiological oscillatory activity in healthy adults before and after oral consumption of water containing very small bubbles of oxygen (electrokinetically modified water).

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in spectral properties measured before and after drinking the test products using Magnetoencephalography (MEG) measurements
primary_outcome.description: Magnetic fields will be recorded using a 275-channel whole-head MEG system

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in localization of spontaneous brain activity measured before and after drinking the test products using Magnetoencephalography (MEG) measurements
primary_outcome.description: Magnetic fields will be recorded using a 275-channel whole-head MEG system

secondary_outcome.measure: Self reported changes in behavioral state before and after drinking test product

facility.name: New York University School of Medicine
